Year-over-year percentage change in homicide rates
Percentage change in homicide rates, 10-year comparison

column2: Source: Statistics Canada, Homicide Survey, Canadian Centre for Justice Statistics.
Homicide includes Criminal Code offences of murder, manslaughter and infanticide.
Population counts are based on July 1st estimates from Statistics Canada, Demography Division.

The total count of a given year's number of homicides could include incidents that occurred in previous years. Homicides are allotted to the year in which they become known to or are deemed homicides by police, according to the report date submitted to Statistics Canada.
